dataset.title: MCR LTER: Coral Reef Resilience: Herbivore Bite Rates on the North Shore Forereef July-August 2010

abstract.para: These data describe bite rates of two abundant species of roving herbivorous fishes found on the forereef, Chlorurus sordidus (Scaridae), and Ctenochaetus striatus (Acanthuridae). During several days in July and August 2010, a SCUBA diver followed individual focal fish for a period of up to 5 minutes and recorded the number of bites taken as well the types of substrates bitten. Upon randomly locating a focal individual, divers estimated the total length of that individual as well as their depth at the initiation (and termination) of the observation. Data are organized in two data tables. The first data table (Focal_Herbivore_Bite_Rates) contains individuals that were observed at two depths (~ 10 m and ~ 17 m) at LTER 1 as part of a balanced sampling design (see Sampling Protocol/Design). The second data table (Additional_Bite_Rate_Data) contains individuals that were observed opportunistically at LTER 1 and Resilience 2. To minimize the effect of time of day on fish behavior, all data were collected between 10:00 and 16:00, a period of time which corresponds with peak feeding rates for many herbivorous fishes.

This material is based upon work supported by the U.S. National Science Foundation under Grant No. OCE 16-37396 (and earlier awards) as well as a generous gift from the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation. Research was completed under permits issued by the French Polynesian Government (Délégation à la Recherche) and the Haut-commissariat de la République en Polynésie Francaise (DTRT) (Protocole d'Accueil 2005-2018). This work represents a contribution of the Moorea Coral Reef (MCR) LTER Site.

keywordSet.keyword: Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station

intellectualRights.para: This data package is released under the Creative Commons license Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0 , see https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). This license states that consumers ("Data Users" herein) may distribute, adapt, reuse, remix, and build upon this work, as long as they give appropriate credit, provide a link to the license, and indicate if changes were made. If redistributed, a Data User may not apply additional restrictions or technological measures that prevent access.

The Data User has an ethical obligation to cite the data source appropriately in any publication or product that results from its use, and notify the data contact or creator. Communication, collaboration, or co-authorship (as appropriate) with the creators of this data package is encouraged to prevent duplicate research or publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplication or inappropriate use. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation may occur if data are used outside of the context of the original study. The Data User should be aware that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data.

While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. This data package (with its components) is made available "as is" and with no warranty of accuracy or fitness for use. The creators of this data package and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for any damages resulting from misinterpretation, use or misuse of the data package or its components.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: LTER 1 polygon including LTER 0 on north shore

description.para: This is a short term dataset. No additional data collection is planned. Data are complete.

changeHistory.comment: Initial receipt of data: Data were received in Excel spreadsheets from Tom Adam, post-doc, and entered to EML by Krystal Treiberg, REU.
Revision 2 is metadata-only, for public release and EML modernizations (cksum, size byte, ORCiD, dateTime)

section.title: Diver Observation
section.para: For the first data table (Focal_Herbivore_Bite_Rates), focal fish were observed during five different hour-long sampling periods (1: 10:00-11:00; 2: 11:00-12:00, 3: 12:00-1:00, 4: 14:00-15:00, 5: 15:00-16:00) local Moorea time. During each period two SCUBA divers each attempted to observe three individuals of each species for a period of five minutes. This protocol was repeated at two depths (~ 10 m and ~ 17 m) to enable among depth comparisons at this site. While divers were unable to recognize individual fish, observations at both depths were carried out in a large area to avoid repeatedly sampling the same individuals.

section.title: Locations
section.para: Forereef habitat within sites named LTER 1 and Resilience 2, both on the north shore.

section.title: References for taxonomy
section.para: Definitive source of taxonomic levels from family to species: Eschmeyer, W. N. (ed.) 'Catalog of Fishes' electronic version (6 May 2010). http://research.calacademy.org/ichthyology/catalog/fishcatmain.asp

Citation for taxonomic levels from phylum to family: Nelson, J.S., 'Fishes of the World', 4th Ed. John Wiley & Sons, Inc., Hoboken, New Jersey, 601 p., 2006 as well as recent rulings by the ICZN http://iczn.org/
Citation for taxonomic levels below family: Randall, J.E., 'Reef and Shore Fishes of the South Pacific', University of Hawaii Press, Honolulu, Hawaii, 707 p., 2005

dataTable.entityDescription: Bite rates of individuals sampled as part of a balanced design

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date of observation as YYYY-MM-DD
Site of observation.
First and last initials of the SCUBA diver.
Species binomial observed.
Estimated size of focal fish to the nearest cm.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Chlorurus sordidus were categorized as Initial phase (IP) or Terminal phase (TP) based on coloration; not applicable to Ctenochaetus striatus.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: Not Applicable

attribute.attributeDefinition: Beginning time for observations.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: End time for observations.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Which of five hour-long periods during which an observation occurred (see Protocol)
Total number of seconds the observation lasted.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Depth at start of video segment, in feet. Positive is down.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Depth at end of video segment, in feet. Positive is down.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Depth as a two-level categorical factor; 10_m observations were initiated between 8 and 12 meters, and 17_m observations were initiated between 15 and 17 meters. Nearly all fish stayed within these bins during the 5 minute observation period.

codeDefinition.definition: Nominal depth is 10 meters. Observations initiated between 8 and 12 meters.
Nominal depth is 17 meters. Observations initiated between 15 and 17 meters.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of bites on bare substrate; bare denotes substrate not occupied by macroscopic benthic invertebrates, macroalgae, or Stegastes turf. Note that although we attempted to differentiate between bare substrate and CCA, in reality this was difficult.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of bites on rubble (unconsolidated chunks of reef generally smaller than approximately 20 cm in diameter).

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of bites on crustose coralline algae. See also comments on Bare.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Bites per minute. (Total_Bites/Seconds_Observed)*60
